item.title: Device Support
item.description: Overview # write a narrative here about current state of affairs Matrix # Capability Android Chrome OS iOS/iPad OS macOS Ubuntu Windows Passkeys (multi-device) Planned Planned iOS 16+ macOS 13+ Not Supported Planned Single-device passkeys Not Supported Not Supported security keys only security keys only security keys only Browser Autofill UI Chrome Edge Firefox Planned Safari Edge Chrome Firefox Safari Chrome Edge Firefox Not Supported Chrome 1 Edge Firefox Cross-Device Authentication

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: TLDR: We do not use cookies and we do not collect any personal data. Website visitors # No personal information is collected. No information is stored in the browser. No information is shared with, sent to or sold to third-parties. No information is shared with advertising companies. No information is mined and harvested for personal and behavioral trends. No information is monetized.

item.title: About
item.description: passkeys.dev is brought to you by the W3C WebAuthn Community Adoption Group and the FIDO Alliance. What’s next? # passkeys.dev was launched in October 2022 and is rapidly evolving. You can expect frequent updates with new content and improvements through the end of 2022 and early 2023 as passkeys continue rolling out across the ecosystem and as guidance is developed for additional use cases and verticals. View Site Roadmap Engage and Contribute # W3C WebAuthn Community Adoption Group GitHub Suggest content or report a site issue FIDO2, WebAuthn, and passkey discussions Twitter “Passkeys & FIDO2 & WebAuthn” Community FIDO Alliance W3C Developers Contribute # Contributing guidance coming soon!

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.description: Intro to passkeys # What is a passkey? Commodo pariatur laboris excepteur excepteur ut nostrud voluptate. What is the difference between a passkey and a multi-device credential? blah What is the difference between a single-device passkey and a multi-device passkey? Ipsum officia dolore incididunt consequat laborum. Do security keys support passkeys? Today, security keys hold single-device passkeys, as they are bound to the authenticator. Security key vendors may decide to offer multi-device passkey authenticators in the future.
